result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryant William Sommers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation. Must be 100% compliant. There is to be zero tolerance.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time.  No contact, directly or indirectly, with Rebecca Jastroch or any other person convicted of a drug offense. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law within 60 days of release from Racine County Jail and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes:
Huber is granted for work, schooling and treatment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required.

AMENDED 02-04-2016; HUBER IS REVOKED

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must advise physicians that he has a problem with opioid medications. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Must pay all costs and fees due and owing to the court. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defense had no additional additions or corrections.

State recommends 4-5 years WPS total on both counts, stands silent as to bifurcation.
Defense requests concurrent time

count 5:  WPS 5 years (2 years IC & 3 years ES)

Defendant Bryant William Sommers in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Arraignment scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Dirk Jensen
Racine County Pretrial Screening Report
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Bryant William Sommers in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Bryant William Sommers in custody.  Eric P. Guttenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
